lead_paragraph: A 41-year-old man was killed and 14 people were injured as rival fans swinging metal pipes and throwing rocks clashed yesterday after a match between Argentine clubs in Buenos Aires.At least 78 arrests were reported in the fighting, which spilled onto a busy rush-hour freeway after Tigre defeated Nueva Chicago, 2-1, which was relegated from Argentina’s first division.The police, who appeared initially overwhelmed by the fighting, were backed up by reinforcements firing tear gas and rubber bullets as rock-throwing fans scattered from the stadium in the Mataderos section of the capital.
